alert.note: Alert for Grand Canyon Country (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued June 15 at 2:28AM MST until June 16 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions, with daytime temperatures ranging from 107 to 112 expected. * WHERE...Lower elevation of the Grand Canyon, from Indian Garden to Phantom Ranch. * WHEN...From 10 AM Wednesday to 8 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: This warning is reserved for only the hottest days of the year and is issued when temperatures are expected to rise to dangerous levels. Day hikers on Bright Angel Trail should descend no further than 1 1/2 miles. Between 10 am and 4 pm...physical activity is discouraged. Hikers should attempt to be out of the canyon...at Indian Garden or Bright Angel campground between these hours. All hikers should have adequate gear...including a wide-brimmed hat... sunscreen...salty snacks...sufficient water and electrolyte mix. Doubling your calorie intake helps maintain your energy. Hike smart!
